page.title: Painting and Decorating Contractors of America

revision.text:
The '''Painting and Decorating Contractors of America''' (PDCA) is a [[non-profit]] association established in 1884<ref>http://www.pdca.org</ref> to represent the [[painter and decorator|painting and decorating]] industry. It was founded as the "Master House Painters Association of the United States and Canada". PDCA has established industry standards, issues publications, and has a [[General contractor|contractor]] accreditation program through [http://www.contractorcollege.org Contractor College]. Members of PDCA can be found throughout the United States, Canada and other countries. They are served regionally and locally by more than 100 volunteer based Councils, Chapters and Forums.
==Findapainter.com== http://www.findapainter.com is PDCA's consumer website, dedicated to connecting homeowners and business owners with qualified, skilled painters they can trust.
== Scholarships == The ''A. E. Robert Friedman/PDCA Scholarship Fund of PDCA'' was formed in 1978 to honor Bob Friedman on the occasion of his fortieth anniversary as [[legal counsel]] for the PDCA. Since 1978, over 158 [[scholarship]]s have been given to students between the ages of 18 and 24 of any background and career choice that have been nominated by an active member of PDCA. It is intended to show the commitment of PDCA members to supporting the educational efforts of young people in search of promising careers. In 2013, seven scholarships of $3,000 per recipient were awarded, up from five scholarships the previous year.
==Annual convention== The association contributes to an annual [[Convention (meeting)|convention]], the "Paintings and Decorating Expo", which presents new developments in the painting and decorating industry. During the event PDCA presents awards to members of the industry.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.pdca.org/page/2018PDCAEXPO | title = Painting and Decorating Expo | accessdate = 2010-09-15}}</ref>
== Education == PDCA offers online education and an accreditation program at [http://contractorcollege.org Contractor College]. Publications created by PDCA have been recognized by other professional organizations for training purposes and reference.
==Industry leadership== PDCA has connected with a variety of groups to provide services to the painting and decorating profession. Some examples of these initiatives have focused on improving [[occupational safety and health]],<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.osha.gov/dcsp/alliances/regional/reg1/pdca_renewal.html | title = OSHA | accessdate = 2008-06-17 }}</ref> and the role of women in painting<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.vtworksforwomen.org/ | title = Vermont Works for Women| accessdate = 2008-06-17 }}</ref>
{{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.pdca.org External Website]
[[Category:Professional associations based in the United States]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1884]] [[Category:Paint and coatings industry]]

{{for|the Tunisian music genre|Ma'luf}} {{Infobox Politician | name = Paulo Maluf | image = Paulo Maluf em setembro de 2015.jpg | caption = | office = [[Chamber of Deputies (Brazil)|Federal Deputy]] for [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]] | term_start = February 1, 2007 | term_end = August 22, 2018 | term_start2 = February 1, 1983 | term_end2 = February 1, 1987 | office3 = 29th and 38th [[List of Mayors of São Paulo|Mayor of São Paulo]] | term_start3 = January 1, 1993 | term_end3 = January 1, 1997 | predecessor3 = [[Luiza Erundina]] | successor3 = [[Celso Pitta]] | constituency3 = | majority3 = | office4 = | term_start4 = April 8, 1969 | term_end4 = April 8, 1971 | appointer4 = [[Artur da Costa e Silva]] | predecessor4 = [[José Vicente Faria Lima]] | successor4 = Figueiredo Ferraz | constituency4 = | majority4 = | office5 = 29th [[List of Governors of São Paulo|Governor of São Paulo]] | term_start5 = March 15, 1979 | term_end5 = May 14, 1982 | vicegovernor5 = [[José Maria Marin]] | predecessor5 = Paulo Egídio Martins | successor5 = [[José Maria Marin]] | constituency5 = | majority5 = | office6 = President of the [[Caixa Econômica Federal|Federal Savings Bank]] | term_start6 = May 13, 1967 | term_end6 = April 7, 1969 | appointer6 = [[Artur da Costa e Silva]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1931|9|3}} | birth_place = [[São Paulo]], [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]], Brazil | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Progressistas|PP]] {{small|(Since 2003)}}
[[Brazilian Progressive Party|PPB]] {{small|(1995–2002)}}
[[Reform Progressive Party|PPR]] {{small|(1992–94)}}
[[Democratic Social Party|PDS]] {{small|(1980–1991)}}
[[National Renewal Alliance Party|ARENA]] {{small|(1967–69)}} | relations = | spouse = | children = | residence = | mother = Marie Estefno Maluf | father = Salim Farah Maluf | alma_mater = [[University of São Paulo]] | occupation = [[Civil engineer]] | religion = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Paulo Salim Maluf''' ({{IPA-pt|ˈpawlu saˈlĩ maˈlufi}}; born September 3, 1931) is a [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] politician with a career spanning over four decades and many functions, including those of State Governor of [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]], Mayor of the [[São Paulo|City of São Paulo]], [[National Congress of Brazil|Congressman]] and [[President of Brazil|Presidential candidate]]. As of 2011, Maluf is on a second consecutive term as [[Chamber of Deputies of Brazil|Federal Deputy]]. His political base is founded on [[populism]] and the provision of major [[public work]]s. His career has been plagued with substantial allegations of [[political corruption|corruption]], although he was only convicted by Brazilian Courts in 2017. He spent a few months in jail and is now under house arrest due to his poor health and advanced age. He is the president of the local branch, in the [[state of São Paulo]], of the right-wing [[Progressive Party of Brazil]] (PP), heir to the old [[National Renewal Alliance Party]] (ARENA). [[Interpol]] has issued a [[Interpol notice|Red Notice]] to arrest Maluf, extradite him and try him in the United States on charges of [[Conspiracy (crime)|conspiracy]] and criminal possession.[http://www.interpol.int/Wanted-Persons/(wanted_id)/2009-13608 Interpol Red Notice for Paulo Maluf][http://exame.abril.com.br/brasil/noticias/10-brasileiros-procurados-pela-interpol-no-mundo-inteiro The 10 Interpol Most-Wanted Brazilians in the World]. Retrieved May 17, 2013 (in Portuguese). ==Early life== Paulo Salim [[Maalouf|Maluf]], the son of [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] Christian immigrants Salim Farah Maluf and Maria Stephan Maluf, was born in [[São Paulo]], and graduated 1954 in engineering at the [[University of São Paulo]] (USP), where coincidentally he was a colleague of the late [[Mário Covas]], another important Brazilian politician who would later become one of his biggest political rivals. At the time a self-acknowledged playboy with a taste for fast-racing [[sportscar]]s,Cf. the self-congratulatory long interview to Tão Gomes Pinto, ''Ele : Maluf, trajetória da audácia '', São Paulo: Ediouro, 2008, {{ISBN|978-85-00-02401-6}}, page 21 Maluf entered professional politics thanks to his family's friendship with the then [[Military dictatorship|military president]] [[Artur da Costa e Silva]], with whom he shared a common interest in [[Horse racing]] bets.John Tofik Karam, ''Another arabesque: Syrian-Lebanese ethnicity in neoliberal Brazil'', Philadelphia: Temple Unioversity Press, 2007, {{ISBN|1-59213-540-4}}, page 50 Banking on this friendship, he was to be appointed mayor of [[São Paulo]] in 1969, replacing the very popular [[José Vicente Faria Lima|Faria Lima]]. In a manner very similar to [[New York City|New York]]’s [[Robert Moses]], he suspended the construction of the [[São Paulo Metro]] and built one of the most controversial constructions of Brazil: [[Costa e Silva]] elevated [[Controlled-access highway|expressway]], also known as ''Minhocão'' (“Big [[Earthworm]]” in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]). This expressway is seen as responsible for the degradation of a great area of [[Downtown São Paulo|São Paulo’s downtown]] by placing a high-traffic elevated road in the middle of a residential area and is considered as the hallmark of the [[Military dictatorship (Brazil)|military dictatorship]]'s – and Maluf's – authoritarian, road enhancementIvani Vassoler, ''Urban Brazil: visions, afflictions, and governance lessons''. Youngstown, Cambria Press, 2007, {{ISBN|978-1-934043-94-3}}, page 140 and private-car-friendly urban policies in São Paulo – its building being made possible only by the impossibility of a public reaction to it on the surrounding community's side.Heitor Frúgoli Jr., ''Centralidade em São Paulo: trajetórias, conflitos e negociações na metrópole ''. São Paulo: Edusp, 2000, {{ISBN|85-314-0966-7}}, page 2000 ==Unsuccessful Contender for the Presidency== [[File:Figueiredo e Maluf.jpg|thumb|Maluf with President [[João Figueiredo]] in the 1980s.]] In 1972, following his mayorship, he served as secretary of transport of the state of São Paulo. He would then dispute a convention of the dictatorship's ruling party, [[Aliança Renovadora Nacional|ARENA]] – which was supposed to be a rubber-stamping caucus aimed at choosing as official "candidate" to the state government the former governor Laudo Natel. Maluf, however, succeed in being appointed official candidateJosé Nêumanne Pinto, ''A República na Lama''. São Paulo: 1992, pages 37/38 for the following indirect elections by the State Legislative – something he did by means of abundant personal (and generous) promises to the convention's members[[Thomas Skidmore]], ''Brasil: De Castelo a Tancredo''. Portuguese trans. of ''The Politics of Military Rule in Brazil, 1964–1985''. São Paulo: Paz e Terra, 1988, pages 475/476 – being afterwards elected governor for the state of [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]] in 1978. During his ensuing term (1979–1983), Maluf used his position for advertising his prospective candidacy to the Presidency in the forthcoming 1985 indirect elections, by means mostly of schemes such as donation of ambulances to impoverished municipalities in Northeastern Brazil, as well as decorating influential people with the State's chief decoration – having them flown to São Paulo free of charge and lodged in luxury hotels before the official decoration ceremony. He also spent wildly in public works, including in some schemes of doubtful validity, such as in an eventually failed plan to move the state's capital city.Skidmore, ''Brazil de Castelo a Tancredo'', 476 It was because of such schemes that one of the most notable accusations of corruption against him emerged, concerning the [[oil company]] [[Paulipetro]]. This was a state company founded by Maluf during his tenure as governor with the purpose of digging the state for [[Petroleum|oil]] and which consumed around US$500 million whilst drilling 21 holes and finding nothing but a few pockets of [[natural gas]] and water. By then, Maluf had already fostered a reputation "for engaging in corrupt machine politics".Skidmore, ''Brazil de Castelo a Tancredo'', 476; Ted George Goertzel, ''Fernando Henrique Cardoso: reinventing democracy in Brazil ''. Boulder: Lynne Riener, 1999, {{ISBN|1-55587-831-8}}, page 88 In 1982, he was elected federal deputy with a then national record 672 629 votes and came to stand as the military's preferred presidential candidate for the 1985 presidential elections – the last to be held by means of an Electoral College – where he stood a good chance of winning. His overweening strategy, however, estranged him from most of the party bosses – the civilian caucus which had provided political support to the military dictatorship in the last twenty years. That caused his PDS party (as the current PP was known at the time) to splinter into the [[Democrats (Brazil)|PFL]], a move that made good the mutual alienation between the ruling military scheme and its civilian base,When the Minister of the Air Force called former PDS bigwig and former governor of [[Bahia]] [[Antônio Carlos Magalhães]], a "traitor", for supporting Tancredo, Magalhães replied in an angry note stating that "a traitor is someone who supports a corrupt": cf. Skidmore, ''Brasil de Castelo a Tancredo'', 485/486 something which resulted in the election of opposition candidate [[Tancredo Neves]]. ==Post-dictatorship career and political resilience== [[File:Maluf Sessim.jpg|thumb|Maluf and fellow Progressive Party Federal Deputy [[Simão Sessim]] in 2007.]] Since then, Maluf only managed to get himself elected to the Executive once, in 1992, again as mayor of [[São Paulo]], despite his participation in nearly every gubernatorial and mayoral election for [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo state]] and [[São Paulo|São Paulo city]], with the exception of 1989 when he was a presidential candidate in the first direct presidential elections since 1960 – in what was a disastrous campaign, remembered in Brazilian political lore only because of Maluf's "antic", said at a speech made to Medical Faculty students in [[Belo Horizonte]]: declaring himself favourable to [[capital punishment]] in cases of rape followed by murder, he said jokingly that "if one has sexual urges, that's okay; rape, but do not kill!" (''estupra mas não mata'').Cf. Maurício Lara, ''Campanha de rua: a cobertura jornalística de uma eleição presidencial''.São Paulo: Geração Editorial, 1994 pg.61. Available at [https://books.google.com/books?id=hIeV0kHMGG0C&pg=PA61&dq=maluf+estupra&hl=en&ei=xS_pS8PTKZCOuAeHhMSpCw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CD8Q6AEwBDgK#v=onepage&q=maluf%20estupra&f=false] Nevertheless, Maluf remained a regional political force in São Paulo, the election of [[Celso Pitta]] as [[São Paulo|São Paulo city]] mayor being directly attributed to his endorsement. When he ended his last mayoral term in 1996, he was considered the best mayor São Paulo had ever had up until then, receiving an 80% approval rate. In 2011, a survey by the Datafolha research firm, after asking, again, a sample of São Paulo locals about who would be the best mayor the city had ever had, obtained the result that Maluf stood first with 47% of the sample's preferences. Such high rates of local approval stand as a reflection of the fact that Maluf was able to forge himself a successful career in post-dictatorship Brazil, despite his perennial reputation for shady deals and for an unsavory personalityCf., among others, Emir Sader & Ken Silverstein,''Without fear of being happy: Lula, the Workers Party and Brazil ''. London: Verso,1991, page 114; Ignacy Sachs, Jorge Wilheim & Paulo Sergio Pinheiro, eds., ''Brazil: A Century of Change ''. Chapel Hill: University of North Carolina Press, {{ISBN|978-0-8078-5927-8}}, page 201; available at [https://books.google.com/books?id=bsHJazhr3EgC&pg=PA201&dq=paulo+maluf+reputation+corruption&hl=en&ei=CDXpS4ffCoGLuAeb_6WiCw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CDMQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=paulo%20maluf%20reputation%20corruption&f=false] pointing directly to his former connections to the authoritarian régime.Cf.John Higley, Richard Günther: ''Elites and Democratic consolidation in Latin America and Southern Europe ''. Cambridge University Press, {{ISBN|0-521-42422-4}}, page 262, available at [https://books.google.com/books?id=mkfEamELMFAC&pg=PA262&dq=paulo+maluf+unsavory&hl=en&ei=aDfpS_qzDYuGuAe_nZG2Cw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=6&ved=0CEIQ6AEwBQ#v=onepage&q=paulo%20maluf%20unsavory&f=false] This has led various scholars to try to explain his political resilience. To some, this resilience is of an ideological nature: having his career nurtured in a right-wing military dictatorship, Maluf came to stand for a kind of reactionary activism, especially strong among small businesspeople and the self-employed,Cf. Maurício Puls, ''O Malufismo'', São Paulo, Publifolha, 2000, as abridged in Lawrence Boudon & Katherine D. McCann, ''Handbook of Latin American Studies: Social Sciences'',59, Austin: University of Texas Press, 2003, {{ISBN|0-292-70535-2}}, page 582 whose hallmark consisted "in the refusal to admit the social character of social problems", proposing instead a heavy-handed approach to them.Cf. Renato Janine Ribeiro, ''O afeto autoritário: televisão, ética e democracia ''. Cotia: Ateliê Editorial, 2004, {{ISBN|85-7480-230-1}}, page 37. Available at [https://books.google.com/books?id=oUIoW_wfO3kC&pg=PA37&dq=malufismo&hl=en&ei=LGrQS636EoS8lQeJtPDIDw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CDoQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=malufismo&f=false] In the words of the philosopher [[Marilena Chaui]], writing in the mid-1980s, ''malufismo'' stood for the privatization of political power: "a fringe form of the [military] dictatorship as it turned from raw force into mob rule".Marilena Chaui, "Maluf ou o Novo Corpo do Rei", ''Lua Nova'', October–December 1984, available at [https://books.google.com/books?id=oV5h_Q7EtDkC&pg=PA37&dq=malufismo&hl=en&ei=NP3fS_PAOYKRuAfh7JHjBg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=10&ved=0CFwQ6AEwCQ#v=onepage&q=malufismo&f=false] ==Later life and money laundering indictments== However, one of the consequences of Pitta's disastrous administration in São Paulo, was that it left the São Paulo municipality mired in debt, as such drawing attention to Maluf's and his former protégé's management practices: in the words of a Brazilian professor at the end of Pitta's term, "Sao Paulo's corruption has been transformed into a public horror from the whispered-about horror it always was". That called eventually for judicial scrutiny of Maluf's policies, especially his public works, his relentless extension of "the city's [São Paulo's] unmitigating concrete sprawl".Both quotes taken from Simon Romero, "Sao Paulo Creaks Under Debt Crisis", ''The New York Times'', April 15, 2000, [https://www.nytimes.com/2000/04/15/business/international-business-sao-paulo-creaks-under-debt-crisis.html?fta=y&incamp=archive:article_related] One notable example of the allegations of corruption that surfaced around Maluf was the [[Ayrton Senna]] tunnel, which passes underneath [[Parque Ibirapuera|Ibirapuera Park]] and cost more, per kilometer, than the [[Channel Tunnel]] (it is alleged that the tunnel cost over US$400 million more than it should). Under dispute is Maluf's personal wealth, which critics attribute to his involvement in corruption scandals; supporters, conversely, point to a legitimate origin of such wealth in his family's companies – namely the mamoooth [[plywood]] trust [[Eucatex]]. Maluf was also part of an extensive investigation, by a Parliamentary Inquiry Committee set up in 2003, regarding [[money laundering]] involving bank accounts held by him and his family in [[Jersey]] (one of the [[Channel Islands]]). He has been convicted of corruption multiple times, but only in 2001 was the sentence final, with no possibility of appeal. At the time, he was forced to pay approximately R$500.000 to the state. Many of his alleged crimes cannot be prosecuted, due to the nature of the Brazilian [[statute of limitations]]. Even if he were to be convicted, there would be serious questions about whether he would serve jail time, as he is over 70 years of age. In early September 2005, Paulo Maluf and his son [[Flávio Maluf]] were temporarily arrested by the Brazilian Federal police, under the charge of intimidating witnesses of an ongoing investigation. They were only incarcerated for a few weeks. So notorious is Maluf's reputation that in Brazil the verb ''malufar'' was created, meaning "to steal public money".{{cite news|title=The lives of those whom Brazil made rich|url=https://www.economist.com/news/books-and-arts/21700363-lives-those-whom-brazil-made-rich-rich-upon-rich|accessdate=10 June 2016|work=[[The Economist]]|date=10 June 2016}} This verb is also sometimes used outside Brazil, with one example being the French newspaper "Le Monde". [http://www.lemonde.fr/web/article/0,1-0,36-688092,0.html] In the [[Brazilian general elections, 2006|2006 elections]], Maluf ran for a seat in the [[Chamber of Deputies of Brazil|Brazilian Chamber of Deputies]], being elected as the candidate for the federal legislature with a national record in terms of ballots cast personally for a candidate to the federal legislature in this particular election (739,837).The Brazilian proportional voting system for parliamentary elections admits ballots cast for a party as well as for a particular candidate to the legislature. Be it said that, although spectacular, Maluf's 2006 voting was roughly half of the greatest ever number of ballots received for a Brazilian congressional election, this record belonging so far to the 1,5 million votes received, in the preceding 2002 elections, by the late congressman - also for São Paulo - [[Enéas Carneiro]]. In relative terms, however, the greatest ever voting for a congressional candidacy still stands with the 269,000 ballots cast for [[Leonel Brizola]] by the defunct [[Guanabara State]]'s electorate in the 1962 election, which comprised a third of all valid ballots. He was reelected again in 2010, with something around 497,000 ballots cast for him."Ficha suja, Maluf tem 497 mil votos, mas não sabe se assumirá". UOL newssite, October 4, 2010, available at [http://eleicoes.uol.com.br/2010/sao-paulo/ultimas-noticias/2010/10/04/ficha-suja-maluf-tem-495-mil-votos-mas-nao-sabe-se-assumira-o-cargo.jhtm] Retrieved May 2, 2012 His 2010 bid for reelection was fraught with legal doubts, as a recent federal statute (Complementary Law 135/2010, commonly known as ''Lei [[Ficha Limpa]]'' or "Clean Record Act") allowed electoral courts to refuse to register the candidacies of people already found guilty by a higher, collegiate court (possibility of further appeals notwithstanding); however, as the Brazilian [[Supremo Tribunal Federal|STF]] decided in March 2011 that the "Clean Record Act" did not apply to the 2010 elections, according to the principle of anteriority (no offence being punished when defined by a non-previously existing law, and a Brazilian electoral law must be in force at least a year before the election is held),[http://www.stf.jus.br/portal/cms/verNoticiaDetalhe.asp?idConteudo=175082 Cf. STF newssite] all charges against Maluf's registration and subsequent office-taking were eventually dropped. During the 2014 elections, Maluf stood again as a congressional candidate, but his candidacy was this time denied acceptance by a 4-to-3 decision of the [[Superior Electoral Court|TSE]].TSE site, [http://www.tse.jus.br/noticias-tse/2014/Setembro/tse-mantem-indeferimento-do-registro-de-candidatura-de-paulo-maluf]. Retrieved October 16, 2014 Pending a recourse to the STF, Maluf was allowed to campaign and to receive ballots cast for him in October 5, 2014, but such votes are legally regarded as null until - and if - his candidacy is declared as lawful. Were this to happen, his 2014 voting would make him the eighth most voted candidate for the Federal Legislature in the State of São Paulo, with 246,446 ballots."Barrado Pela Ficha Limpa, Paulo Maluf Tem Mais De 240 Mil Votos". Agencia Estadão, 5 October 2014, [http://epocanegocios.globo.com/Informacao/Resultados/noticia/2014/10/barrado-pela-ficha-limpa-paulo-maluf-tem-mais-de-240-mil-votos.html]. Retrieved October 16, 2014 On March 9, 2007, [[Robert M. Morgenthau]] of the Manhattan's District Attorney's office issued an [https://www.nytimes.com/2007/03/09/world/americas/09indict.html?em&ex=1173589200&en=0097af41dc0be82b&ei=5087%0A www.nytimes.com] indictment against Paulo Maluf for money laundering in relation to a kickback and inflated invoice scheme that allegedly stole $11.6m from a Brazilian road contract project totaling $140 million. From November 1997 to May 1999 the money passed through an account at the [[Safra National Bank of New York]] and was secretly controlled by Maluf. This indictment was maintained by a New York judge on April 25, 2012, who dismissed a petition from the Malufs, Paulo and Flávio, who sought a court order to toss out the indictment.Karen Freifeld (Reuters), "New York judge refuses to dismiss Brazilian kickback case".''Chicago Tribune'', April 25, 2012, available at [http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/sns-rt-us-maluf-nychargesbre83o1is-20120425,0,6793939.story]. Retrieved April 29, 2012 Also refused by the same judge was the Malufs' bid for having lifted their March 2010 inclusion in the [[Interpol notice|Red notice]] of [[Interpol]],Maluf's red notice is available on [http://www.interpol.int/Wanted-Persons/(wanted_id)/2009-13608]. Accessed July 28, 2012 which makes them subject to arrest and [[extradition]] in 181 countries. As this [[arrest warrant]] is not valid in Brazil because the [[Constitution of Brazil|Brazilian Constitution]] does not allow for the extradition of Brazilian citizens,[http://oglobo.globo.com/pais/mat/2010/03/19/paulo-maluf-entra-para-lista-de-procurados-da-interpol-916123917.asp Inclusion in the Red Notice of Interpol (in Portuguese)] its practical meaning is that the Malufs are to be arrested if they travel outside Brazil. In addition, Maluf and his son Flávio were sentenced to three years in prison (along with a two-year sentence for his wife Sylvia) in France in 2016.{{cite news|last1=Ramirez|first1=Sughey|title=French Court Sentences Former Brazilian Mayor to Three Years in Prison|url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/internacional/en/brazil/2016/03/1745821-french-court-sentences-former-brazilian-mayor-to-three-years-in-prison.shtml|accessdate=18 March 2016|publisher=Folha de S.Paulo|date=3 March 2016}} On 20 December 2017, after being convicted of corruption by the Supreme Court of Brazil and after a few attempts to challenge that conviction by means of internal appeals within the Supreme Court, Maluf surrendered to Brazilian police, to begin his prison sentence as ordered. On 30 March 2018 he was released from prison under house arrest on humanitarian grounds, due to his advanced age and poor health. He currently remains under house arrest and, as ordered by the Brazilian Supreme Court, in August 2018 the Chamber of Deputies of Brazil officially declared that, as a result of his conviction, Maluf lost his Federal Deputy seat. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{Succession box | before=[[José Vicente Faria Lima]] | title=Appointed [[List of Mayors of São Paulo|Mayor of São Paulo]] | after=[[José Carlos de Figueiredo Ferraz]] | years=1969–1971}} {{Succession box | before=[[Paulo Egydio Martins]] | title=Appointed [[List of Governors of São Paulo|Governor of São Paulo]]|after=[[José Maria Marin]] | years=1979–1982}} {{Succession box | before=[[Luiza Erundina]] | title=[[List of Mayors of São Paulo|Mayor of São Paulo]] | after=[[Celso Pitta]] | years=1993–1996}} {{s-end}} {{SãoPauloGovernors}} {{Mayors of São Paulo}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Maluf, Paulo}} [[Category:1931 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Businesspeople from São Paulo]] [[Category:Brazilian businesspeople]] [[Category:Brazilian Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Governors of São Paulo (state)]] [[Category:Mayors of São Paulo]] [[Category:Brazilian people of Lebanese descent]] [[Category:Brazilian people of Levantine-Eastern Orthodox Christian descent]] [[Category:University of São Paulo alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party (Brazil) politicians]] [[Category:National Renewal Alliance Party politicians]] [[Category:Reform Progressive Party politicians]] [[Category:Brazilian politicians convicted of crimes]]

revision.comment: /* World War II */ "French resistance" has its own article; no need to link it to broad/generic one. Also linked "Colditz Castle" to more appropriate article.
revision.text:
{{Infobox military person |name=Per Bergsland |image= |caption= |allegiance=[[Norway]] |rank=Sergeant |commands=[[Supermarine Spitfire|Spitfire]] ''VB AB269 AH:D'' |unit=[[No. 332 Squadron RAF]] (332 Sqn) |family= |nickname=Peter Rockland |birth_date={{birth date|1918|1|17|df=y}} |death_date={{death date and age|1992|6|9|1918|1|17|df=y}} |birth_place=Norway |serviceyears= |laterwork= |awards= }}
Sgt '''Per Bergsland''' (17 January 1918 – 9 June 1992) was a [[Norwegians|Norwegian]] [[POW]] in the [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[POW camp]] [[Stalag Luft III]] and one of only three men to escape to freedom in the "[[Stalag Luft III#The "Great Escape"|Great Escape]]".<ref>[https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/greatescape/three.html ''The Great Escape - The Three That Got Away''(Nova)]</ref>
==Sports career== During in the 1930s Bergsland competed in [[orienteering]], representing the club [[IL Heming]]. In 1939 he placed second at the individual Norwegian championship in orienteering held at [[Modum]].<ref name=o90>{{cite book |title=Orienteringsidretten i Norge gjennom 90 år |editor1=Berglia, Knut |editor2=Brohaug, Tom-Erik |editor3=Staver, Kristoffer |editor4=Thuesen, Kaare |editor5=Strandhagen, Torgeir |pages=71–76 |year=1987 |language=Norwegian |publisher=[[Norges Orienteringsforbund]] |location=Oslo }}</ref> He was born in Bærum, but resided at [[Ullern]]åsen.<ref>{{cite news|title=Dagens navn|work=Aftenposten|date=16 January 1988|page=20|language=Norwegian}}</ref>
==World War II== Per Bergsland served as an instructor at flight school in [[Canada]] before he transferred to the [[RAF Ferry Command]], where he was assigned to fly with a combat unit. As a member of [[No. 332 Squadron RAF]] (332 Sqn) stationed at [[North Weald]] airfield, Bergsland's [[Supermarine Spitfire Mk.Vb]], (serial no AB269, coded AH:D) was shot down by a German [[Focke-Wulf Fw 190]] during the [[Dieppe Raid]] on 19 August 1942. After arriving at the POW camp, he gave his name as "Peter Rockland" (''Per'' = [[Petrus (given name)|Petrus]], meaning rock in [[Greek language|Greek]], and ''Berg'' meaning mountain or rock in [[Norwegian language|Norwegian]]), in order to protect his family in Norway from German reprisals.
[[File:Model Stalag Luft III.jpg|thumb|300px|''Stalag Luft III'' mockup.]]
In what later became known as the "Great Escape", he was escapee #43 among the 76 prisoners of war who managed to escape from the camp via tunnel with another Norwegian pilot, escapee #44 [[Jens Müller (pilot)|Jens Müller]],
{{Quote |text="Bergsland was wearing a civilian suit he had made for himself from a Royal Marine uniform, with an RAF overcoat slightly altered with brown leather sewn over the buttons. A black RAF tie, no hat. He carried a small suitcase which had been sent from Norway. In it were Norwegian toothpaste and soap, sandwiches, and 163 reichsmarks given to him by the Escape Committee.
We caught the 2:04 train to [[Frankfurt an der Oder]]. Our papers stated that we were Norwegian electricians from the Arbeitslager [labor camp] in Frankfurt working in the vicinity of Sagan. For the journey from Frankfurt to [[Stettin]] we had other papers ordering us to change our place of work from Frankfurt to Stettin, and to report to the Birgermeister of Stettin."<ref>[https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/greatescape/three.html ''The Great Escape - The Three That Got Away''(Nova)]</ref> }}
Bergsland and Müller made it to the nearby town, where they caught a train to [[Szczecin|Stettin]] in Germany (now: [[Szczecin]], Poland). At the port, the pair were snuck onto a Swedish ship by friendly sailors and made it to the safety of [[Gothenburg]]. There, they met the British consulate, who arranged travel by train to [[Stockholm]], where they were flown to [[Scotland]] from [[Bromma]] airport. From there they were sent by train to [[London]] and shortly afterwards to '[[Little Norway]]' in Canada.<ref>[http://www.profero.no/littlenorway/Personell_Little_Norway_1940-1945.pdf ''List of personnel associated with Little Norway'' (Edvard Omholt-Jensen "The Spirit of Little Norway" Atheneum. 1986)]</ref>
In total, only three POWs from Stalag Luft III made it to [[Neutral country|neutral countries]] and freedom.
The third escapee was the [[Netherlands|Dutchman]] [[Bram van der Stok]], who crossed most of occupied Europe and escaped to Spain with the help of the [[French resistance]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/military-obituaries/air-force-obituaries/5648616/Bram-van-der-Stok.html|work=Daily Telegraph|title=Obituary - Bram van der Stok|date=1 July 1993}}</ref>
The remaining 73 escapees were captured. [[Adolf Hitler]] wanted to [[Execution (legal)|execute]] them all, but [[Hermann Göring]] persuaded him not to: in the end, fifty were shot as an example. The remaining 23 were held in the custody of the [[Gestapo]] before being sent off to other camps. 17 were returned to [[Stalag Luft III]], four were sent to [[Sachsenhausen (detention camp)|Sachsenhausen]], and two to [[Oflag IV-C|Colditz Castle]].
==Postwar career== In 1946, Per Bergsland began as a pilot in [[Fred Olsen Air Transport]]. He later became Chief Pilot and Operational Manager. Per Bergsland became CEO of [[Fred Olsen Air Transport]] in 1968 and CEO of [[Widerøe]] from 1970 to 1981.
== See also == * ''[[The Great Escape (film)|The Great Escape]]'' *''[[Tre kom tilbake]]'' *[[History of Widerøe]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Related reading== * Carroll, Tim (2004) ''The Great Escaper'' (Mainstream Publishing) {{ISBN|1-84018-904-5}} * Brickhill, Paul (1950) ''The Great Escape'' (W. W. Norton & Company) {{ISBN|978-0-393-32579-9}} * Burgess, Alan (1990) ''The Longest Tunnel'' (Bloomsbury Publishing) {{ISBN|0-7475-0589-6}} * Durand, Arthur A (1989) ''Stalag Luft III'' (Patrick Stephens Ltd) {{ISBN|1-85260-248-1}}
==External links== *[http://www.muzeum.eline2.serwery.pl/index.php?id=22&lng=eng Museum of Allied Prisoners of War Martyrdom]

revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=January 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox company | name = Town & Country Surf Designs | logo = [[Image:T&c logo.png|T&C Surf logo]] | type = [[Public company|Public]] | traded_as = | genre = | foundation = [[Pearl City]], [[Hawaii]], (1971) | founder = | location_city = [[Pearl City]], [[Hawaii]] | location_country = [[United States]] | location = | locations = | area_served = | key_people = Craig Sugihara, Tak Kawahara | industry = | products = [[clothing|Apparel]], [[Sports equipment|sporting goods]] | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | caption = | homepage = http://tcsurf.com | footnotes = | intl = }}
'''Town & Country Surf Designs''' (also known as T&C Surf) is a world recognized manufacturer of [[surfboard]]s. T&C's origins began in 1971 with a single store founded by [[Craig Sugihara]] in [[Pearl City, Hawaii]]. The company soon expanded into a full line of [[surfwear]] and [[surfing]] accessories and now has retail shops throughout the world in countries such as [[Japan]], [[Australia]], and [[Peru]].
In 1976, [[Tak Kawahara]] became the co-owner of Town & Country (T&C) Surfboard’s wholesale division and developed the apparel brand, which became one of the top five in the beach and active surfwear industry. During his tenure at T&C he expanded the brand’s product line by introducing surf watches, beach sandals and school stationery accessories, all of which were the first of its kind in the surfing industry. T&C was also the first surf label to take production off shore. Tak continues to consult with many surf companies on product design, production processes, marketing, sales and operations.
In the 1980s, T&C became famous for their shirt designs featuring "Da' Boys," surfing cartoon characters designed by [[Steve Nazar]]. The most famous of these was Thrilla Gorilla, a surfing anthropomorphic gorilla. In 1988, [[LJN]] released a game on the [[NES]] based on the store, entitled ''[[Town & Country Surf Designs: Wood & Water Rage]]''. A sequel focusing on Thrilla Gorilla (''[[Town & Country II: Thrilla's Surfari]]'') followed in 1992, before the character designs disappeared until re-launching as part of the [http://www.thrillakrewgear.com/ Thrilla Krew] brand in 2016.
==See also== *[[Billabong (clothing)|Billabong]] *[[Quiksilver]] *[[Rip Curl]] *[[CHP (California and Hawaii Promotions)]] *[[Con Surfboards]]
==External links== *[http://tcsurf.com Official website] *[http://stevenazar.com Steve Nazar's official website]

{{more citations needed|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Veselin Jevrosimovic | image = | caption = | birth_date = 1966 | birth_place = [[Belgrade]], [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia]] (now [[Serbia]]) | occupation = Founder and CEO of ComTrade Group | spouse = 1st wife Ines Pokimica, 2nd wife Anja Aleksic | children = Daughter and son | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Florida]] | website = https://www.comtrade.com ; http://www.jevrosimovic.com/biografija | signature = }} '''Veselin Jevrosimovic''' ({{lang-sr-cyr|Веселин Јевросимовић}}; born 1966)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tv.novosti.rs/code/navigate.php?Id=40|title=TV Novosti {{!}} Veselin Jevrosimović: NAJVEĆA ŽENSKA TAJNA JE..|website=www.tv.novosti.rs|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> is an influential businessman in [[Serbia]] who is known for being the owner and chairman of the IT company [[ComTrade Group]].<ref>https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=49140236&privcapId=7770417</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/english/1623910-veselin-jevrosimovic-in-the-german-der-spiegel-this-is-what-the-owner-of-comtrade-said-to-foreign-investors|title=Veselin Jevrosimović in the German "Der Spiegel": This is what the owner of Comtrade said to foreign investors!|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> Referred to as the “Serbian [[Bill Gates]]”,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.blic.rs/zabava/vesti/sedam-velicanstvenih-frajera-sa-balkana/sfzwhd7|title=Sedam veličanstvenih... frajera sa Balkana|work=Blic.rs|access-date=2018-05-27|language=sr}}</ref> he also owns the digital media publication Telegraf.rs, headquartered in [[Belgrade]], and is the president of the Athletic Association of Serbia.
==Background== Born in [[Belgrade]] to a working-class family, Jevrosimovic was a sprinter for the national junior track and field team.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ekapija.com/people/294875/veselin-jevrosimovic-comtrade-group-dobri-milioner-iz-komsiluka|title=Veselin Jevrosimović, ComTrade Group - dobri milioner iz komšiluka|website=www.ekapija.com|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> He then studied electrical engineering in [[Serbia]] and management at the [[University of Florida]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.jevrosimovic.com/biografija/|title=Biografija {{!}} Veselin Jevrosimović|website=Veselin Jevrosimović|language=sr-RS|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ekapija.com/people/294875/veselin-jevrosimovic-comtrade-group-dobri-milioner-iz-komsiluka|title=Veselin Jevrosimović, ComTrade Group - dobri milioner iz komšiluka|website=www.ekapija.com|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> In addition to living in the United States, he resided in [[Düsseldorf]], [[Germany]] for 8 years.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/hi-tech/zanimljivosti-hi-tech/2923422-veselin-jevrosimovic-o-tome-kako-je-comtrade-preziveo-svetsku-ekonomsku-krizu-zabranio-sam-otpustanje-ako-brod-tone-svi-cemo-potonuti-zajedno-foto|title=Veselin Jevrosimović o tome kako je Comtrade preživeo svetsku ekonomsku krizu: Zabranio sam otpuštanje, ako brod tone, svi ćemo potonuti zajedno (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ekapija.com/people/294875/veselin-jevrosimovic-comtrade-group-dobri-milioner-iz-komsiluka|title=Veselin Jevrosimović, ComTrade Group - dobri milioner iz komšiluka|website=www.ekapija.com|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> He was previously married to Ines Pokimica and they have one daughter.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tv.novosti.rs/code/navigate.php?Id=40|title=TV Novosti {{!}} Veselin Jevrosimović: NAJVEĆA ŽENSKA TAJNA JE..|website=www.tv.novosti.rs|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.blic.rs/vesti/hronika/jevrosimovic-samo-su-kukavice-sposobne-da-bace-bombe-na-zenu-i-dete/z7z4vtt|title=Jevrosimović: Samo su kukavice sposobne da bace bombe na ženu i dete|work=Blic.rs|access-date=2018-05-27|language=sr}}</ref> His second wife is Anja Aleksic with whom he has a son.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/vesti/beograd/2025646-kompanija-comtrade-donirala-40-tesla-tableta-ucenici-sa-smetnjama-u-razvoju-sada-ce-mnogo-lakse-uciti-foto|title=Kompanija Comtrade donirala 40 Tesla tableta: Učenici sa smetnjama u razvoju sada će mnogo lakše učiti (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.svet.rs/vesti/estrada/kad-vesa-dobije-sina-slavlje-do-zore-srdan-dokovic-svira-harmoniku|title=Kad Vesa dobije sina: Slavlje do zore, Srđan Đoković svira harmoniku!|work=Svet portal|access-date=2018-05-27|language=en-US}}</ref> In 2013, a bomb was thrown at one of his homes in [[Serbia]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.blic.rs/vesti/hronika/jevrosimovic-samo-su-kukavice-sposobne-da-bace-bombe-na-zenu-i-dete/z7z4vtt|title=Jevrosimović: Samo su kukavice sposobne da bace bombe na ženu i dete|work=Blic.rs|access-date=2018-05-27|language=sr}}</ref> He also owns real estate in [[Miami]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.alo.rs/vip/estrada/irma-progutala-breninu-vilu-od-milion-evra/122507/vest|title="Irma" progutala Breninu vilu od milion evra!|last=Alo!|work=alo|access-date=2018-05-27|language=sr}}</ref>
==Career== Jevrosimovic's career in technology began in 1986, when he became co-owner of a business that distributed IT equipment in [[Germany]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.jevrosimovic.com/biografija/|title=Biografija {{!}} Veselin Jevrosimović|website=Veselin Jevrosimović|language=sr-RS|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> Starting in 1991, he was a partner for five years in [[CHS Electronics]], before leaving to found the Serbian company [[ComTrade Group]] in 1996.<ref>https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=49140236&privcapId=7770417</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.jevrosimovic.com/biografija/|title=Biografija {{!}} Veselin Jevrosimović|website=Veselin Jevrosimović|language=sr-RS|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> The firm is mostly known for selling computers and tablets, having come up with the first Serbian desktop and notebook in 2006.<ref>https://www.vreme.com/cms/view.php?id=458395</ref> However, in addition to hardware, ComTrade currently focuses on offering software solutions to institutions and corporations. According to Jevrosimovic, his company's specialty is software development for large storage systems, as well as producing on-line games of chance.<ref>https://www.vreme.com/cms/view.php?id=1038151</ref>
ComTrade wrote the code for the warehouse robots used at [[Amazon.com]]. It also developed the software infrastructure at [[Ryanair]] and various luggage transport systems.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://svetkapitala.delo.si/ikonomija/iz-krize-smo-se-izkopali-s-prijemi-iz-casopisov-4439|title=Iz krize smo se izkopali s prijemi iz časopisov|access-date=2018-05-27|language=hr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/hi-tech/zanimljivosti-hi-tech/2923422-veselin-jevrosimovic-o-tome-kako-je-comtrade-preziveo-svetsku-ekonomsku-krizu-zabranio-sam-otpustanje-ako-brod-tone-svi-cemo-potonuti-zajedno-foto|title=Veselin Jevrosimović o tome kako je Comtrade preživeo svetsku ekonomsku krizu: Zabranio sam otpuštanje, ako brod tone, svi ćemo potonuti zajedno (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> In 2015, the company joined [[CERN]] as an associate member and now manages the nuclear research lab's database.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.comtrade.com/our-impact/researchers-worldwide-access-cern-data-via-our-data-sharing-system/|title=Researchers worldwide access CERN data via our data sharing system - Comtrade|work=Comtrade|access-date=2018-05-27|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>https://openlab-archive-phases-iv-v.web.cern.ch/resources/press_release/comtrade-facilitates-global-access-cern-research</ref> In 2016, the firm partnered with [[Citrix]] to develop management packs for their platforms.<ref>http://bostonvoyager.com/interview/meet-simon-taylor-comtrade-software-financial-district/</ref> Additionally, ComTrade has the largest artificial intelligence division in South Eastern Europe.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/hi-tech/zanimljivosti-hi-tech/2923422-veselin-jevrosimovic-o-tome-kako-je-comtrade-preziveo-svetsku-ekonomsku-krizu-zabranio-sam-otpustanje-ako-brod-tone-svi-cemo-potonuti-zajedno-foto|title=Veselin Jevrosimović o tome kako je Comtrade preživeo svetsku ekonomsku krizu: Zabranio sam otpuštanje, ako brod tone, svi ćemo potonuti zajedno (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref>
The company has offices in [[New York City|New York]], [[San Francisco]], [[Budapest]], [[Ireland]] and the [[Philippines]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/hi-tech/zanimljivosti-hi-tech/2923422-veselin-jevrosimovic-o-tome-kako-je-comtrade-preziveo-svetsku-ekonomsku-krizu-zabranio-sam-otpustanje-ako-brod-tone-svi-cemo-potonuti-zajedno-foto|title=Veselin Jevrosimović o tome kako je Comtrade preživeo svetsku ekonomsku krizu: Zabranio sam otpuštanje, ako brod tone, svi ćemo potonuti zajedno (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> In 2008, it acquired the [[Slovenia]]n software firm Hermes Softlab. In 2014, ComTrade Group launched the Tesla brand of tablets, smartphones and TVs. In 2016, ComTrade Software, a subsidiary of [[ComTrade Group]], launched its international headquarters in [[Boston]].<ref>https://www.bostonglobe.com/business/2016/09/06/comtrade-software-opens-first-office-boston/siAWVGQLlmrXgSeqFdvF9O/story.html</ref> In 2017, Jevrosimovic opened the parent company's 18th office in the city of [[Dubai]], as well as a technology center in [[Cacak]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://pcpress.rs/veselin-jevrosimovic-informaticki-opismenjena-deca-su-nasa-buducnost/|title=Veselin Jevrosimović – Informatički opismenjena deca su naša budućnost|date=2018-01-15|work=PC Press|access-date=2018-05-27|language=en-US}}</ref> Comtrade employs 1,200 software engineers and has been a member of the [[World Economic Forum]] since 2009.<ref>https://www.vreme.com/cms/view.php?id=1038151</ref>
In addition to his IT services company, Jevrosimovic owns a private college in [[Serbia]] that trains software engineers.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/hi-tech/zanimljivosti-hi-tech/2923422-veselin-jevrosimovic-o-tome-kako-je-comtrade-preziveo-svetsku-ekonomsku-krizu-zabranio-sam-otpustanje-ako-brod-tone-svi-cemo-potonuti-zajedno-foto|title=Veselin Jevrosimović o tome kako je Comtrade preživeo svetsku ekonomsku krizu: Zabranio sam otpuštanje, ako brod tone, svi ćemo potonuti zajedno (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> He has also been president of the Athletic Association of Serbia since 2009, building 15 stadiums and organizing the 2017 European Athletics Championship.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://pcpress.rs/veselin-jevrosimovic-informaticki-opismenjena-deca-su-nasa-buducnost/|title=Veselin Jevrosimović – Informatički opismenjena deca su naša budućnost|date=2018-01-15|work=PC Press|access-date=2018-05-27|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.novosti.rs/vesti/sport.297.html:714961-Jevrosimovic-Ovo-zlato-nisu-mogli-da-uzmu|title=Jevrosimović: Ovo zlato nisu mogli da uzmu|website=www.novosti.rs|language=sr-Latn|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> In 2012, he became a member of Serbia's Olympic Committee.<ref>http://klubprivrednik.rs/en/members/veselin-jevrosimovic/</ref> As owner of Telegraf.rs, Jevrosimović regularly contributes to a column for the technology section of the [[Serbia]]n digital newspaper.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.blic.rs/vesti/hronika/jevrosimovic-samo-su-kukavice-sposobne-da-bace-bombe-na-zenu-i-dete/z7z4vtt|title=Jevrosimović: Samo su kukavice sposobne da bace bombe na ženu i dete|work=Blic.rs|access-date=2018-05-27|language=sr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/hi-tech/zanimljivosti-hi-tech/2921225-veselin-jevrosimovic-u-2018-godini-vestacka-inteligencija-postace-jos-naprednija|title=VESELIN JEVROSIMOVIĆ: U 2018. godini veštačka inteligencija postaće još naprednija|website=www.telegraf.rs|language=sr|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref> Additionally he owns the Majik Cafe in [[Belgrade]], which was designed by [[Karim Rashid]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.karimrashid.com/projects/#category_7/project_291|title=Projects|website=www.karimrashid.com|language=en|access-date=2018-05-27}}</ref>
==Awards and distinctions== In 2008, Jevrosimović became the first [[Serb]] to be recognized as an honorary citizen of [[Boston]], for his company's contributions to the city's economy.<ref>https://www.blic.rs/vesti/drustvo/predsednik-komtrejda-postao-pocasni-gradanin-bostona/n6qzvj7</ref><ref>https://www.comtrade.com/news/president-of-comtrade-group-becomes-honor-citizen-of-boston/</ref> As for awards, he has been recognized for being a "Top Manager of Southeastern Europe", an "IT Industry Legend (Monte Carlo)",<ref>https://www.vreme.com/cms/view.php?id=1038151</ref> and the "Most Innovative Investor in Southeastern Europe".<ref>http://klubprivrednik.rs/en/members/veselin-jevrosimovic/</ref> In 2017, Jevrosimovic attended the inauguration of American President [[Donald Trump]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.blic.rs/vesti/drustvo/veselin-jevrosimovic-na-trampovoj-inauguraciji/pbsv03p|title=Veselin Jevrosimović na Trampovoj inauguraciji|work=Blic.rs|access-date=2018-05-27|language=sr}}</ref> ==References== <references />
==External links== * https://www.comtrade.com
{{DEFAULTSORT:Jevrosimovic, Veselin}} [[Category:Serbian technology writers]] [[Category:Computer programmers]] [[Category:Serbian businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of Florida alumni]] [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:People from Belgrade]]

revision.text:
{{otherpeople}} {{Infobox military person | name =Viktor Ivanov | native_name =Виктор Петрович Иванов | native_name_lang =rus | image =Viktor Ivanov.jpg | caption =Viktor Ivanov | birth_date ={{birth date and age|1950|05|12}} | death_date = | placeofburial = | placeofburial_label = | birth_place = | death_place = | placeofburial_coordinates = | nickname = | allegiance =[[Soviet Union]] | branch =[[KGB]] | serviceyears =1987-1988 | rank = | servicenumber = | unit = | commands = | battles =[[Soviet war in Afghanistan]] | battles_label = | awards = | relations = | laterwork = }}
'''Viktor Petrovich Ivanov''' ({{lang-ru|Виктор Петрович Иванов}}, born May 12, 1950, [[Novgorod]], [[Soviet Union]]) is a [[Russia]]n politician and businessman, former [[KGB]] officer,<ref name=twsBag>{{cite news |title= New jobs, old faces: The line-up confirms that Vladimir Putin is still in control |publisher= ''The Economist'' |quote= Also seemingly sidelined is Viktor Ivanov, a hardline ex-spook who worked closely with Mr Sechin. |date= May 15, 2008 |url= http://www.economist.com/node/11376699 |accessdate= 2011-01-02 }}</ref> who served in the KGB Directorate of [[Leningrad]] and its successors in 1977–1994. He was the Director of [[Federal Narcotics Control Service|The Federal Narcotics Service of Russia]] from 2008 until 2016.
In 1987–1988 as a KGB officer he took part in the [[Soviet war in Afghanistan]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite journal|url = https://foreignpolicy.com/articles/2010/10/22/interview_viktor_ivanov|title = Interview: Viktor Ivanov|last = Keating|first = Joshua E.|date = 22 October 2010 |journal=[[Foreign Policy]] |accessdate = 19 November 2014|doi = |pmid = }}</ref>
In December 1990 together with [[Boris Gryzlov]] and [[Valentin Chuykin]] he founded the small-scale enterprise Blok engaged in various businesses and became its director.
In October 1994 he resigned from [[FSK (Russia)|FSK]] and was appointed Chief of the Administrative Staff of the [[Saint Petersburg]] [[Saint Petersburg City Administration|Mayor Office]]. In 1999 he succeeded [[Nikolai Patrushev]] as the Head of the Internal Security Department of Russia's [[Federal Security Service|FSB]]. Since January 5, 2000, he has been a Deputy Head of the Presidential Staff for personnel appointed by [[Vladimir Putin]]. Viktor Ivanov is considered one of Putin's closest allies.
In September 2001 Russia's Prime Minister appointed Ivanov representative of the state in the Boards of Directors of the [[Antei Corporation]] and [[Almaz Scientific Industrial Corporation]], developing and producing air defence systems, including [[S-300 (missile)|S-300]]. On November 22, 2001, he was elected Chairman of the Board of Directors of Almaz and initiated the merger of Almaz and Antei. Since June 2002 Ivanov has been the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the result of the merger, OJSC [[Almaz-Antei]] Air Defense Concern.
Since November 4, 2004, he has also been the Chairman of the Board of Directors of JSC [[Aeroflot]] airline.
==Head of Federal Narcotics Control Service== Since May 15, 2008, he has been a Director of Russia’s [[Federal Narcotics Control Service|Federal Service for the Control of Narcotics]]<ref name=twsBaf>{{cite news |author= Wu Jiao and Li Xiaokun |title= SCO leaders may make crucial Afghan decisions |publisher= ''China Daily'' |quote= Russia's drug control chief Viktor Ivanov warned last month in Beijing: "Drugs produced in Afghanistan are flowing to Russia and China, intensifying regional instability, |date= 2010-06-11 |url= http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010sco/2010-06/11/content_9963918.htm |accessdate= 2011-01-02 }}</ref> and a Chairman of State Anti-Narcotics Committee, which includes 29 Heads of Russian Ministries.
In 2010, when the State of California in the United States had a ballot initiative asking voters about the legalization of marijuana, Ivanov public spoke out against it. He flew to Los Angeles and Washington, D.C., to lobby against drug legalization, meeting with the Los Angeles mayor, Los Angeles county sheriff, and U.S. drug czar.<ref name=":0" />
In 2015 Ivanov pointed out that [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|Islamic State]], like [[Boko Haram]], is supported significantly through money made by trafficking Afghan [[heroin]].<ref name=ivanov>{{cite web| url=http://www.rt.com/politics/310571-isis-economy-based-on-illegal/ |author= |title=ISIS economy based on illegal drug trade - Russian anti-drug chief |publisher=RT |date=July 23, 2015 |accessdate=July 24, 2015}}</ref> He called out for a global alliance to liquidate drug production and develop alternative sources of income in drug-producing areas.<ref name=ivanov2>{{cite web |url=http://www.rt.com/politics/russia-drugs-afghanistan-threat-069/ |author= |title=Russian anti-drug chief urges new plan to counter Afghanistan drug threat| publisher=RT |date=March 25, 2015 |accessdate=July 24, 2015}}</ref> Ivanov who was [[blacklisting|blacklisted]] by the United States in the aftermath of the 2014 [[Crimean Crisis]]<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.rt.com/politics/official-word/242485-viktor-ivanov-rt-interview/ |author= |title=‘Drug lords danced with joy, when US blacklisted me’ – Russian anti-drug chief |publisher=RT |date=March 20, 2015 |accessdate=July 24, 2015}}</ref> also accused the United States of deliberately undermining international efforts of anti-drug cooperation.<ref name=ivanov2/>
==Sanctions== March 20th 2014, the [[Office of Foreign Assets Control]] (OFAC) published that Victor Ivanov and 19 other men have been added to the [[Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons|Specially Designated Nationals List]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Treasury Sanctions Russian Officials, Members Of The Russian Leadership’s Inner Circle, And An Entity For Involvement In The Situation In Ukraine |url=http://www.treasury.gov/press-center/press-releases/Pages/jl23331.aspx |publisher=US Department of the treasury}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Executive Order - Blocking Property of Additional Persons Contributing to the Situation in Ukraine |url=http://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2014/03/20/executive-order-blocking-property-additional-persons-contributing-situat |publisher=The White House - Office of the Press Secretary}}</ref><ref>[http://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/OFAC-Enforcement/Pages/20140320_33.aspx www.treasury.gov]</ref><ref>[http://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/SDN-List/Pages/default.aspx Specially Designated Nationals List (SDN)]</ref><ref name=Sanctions>{{cite web | last = Shuklin | first = Peter | title = Putin's inner circle: who got in a new list of US sanctions | url = https://news.liga.net/articles/politics/1066761-blizhniy_krug_putina_kto_popal_v_novyy_spisok_sanktsiy_ssha.htm | publisher = liga.net | date = March 21, 2014 | accessdate = February 20, 2016 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20150207152258/http://news.liga.net/articles/politics/1066761-blizhniy_krug_putina_kto_popal_v_novyy_spisok_sanktsiy_ssha.htm | archive-date = February 7, 2015 | dead-url = yes | df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=Ukraine-EO13661>{{cite web | last = President of The United States | title = Ukraine EO13661 | url = https://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/Programs/Documents/ukraine_eo2.pdf | publisher = Federal Register | date = March 19, 2016 | accessdate = February 20, 2016}}</ref>
==References and notes== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Ivanov, Viktor}} [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Aeroflot]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Russian politicians]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel of the Soviet–Afghan War]]
